articles.title: Guardiola tells team to chill with cocktails as Man City pile pressure on Arsenal
articles.description: As Manchester City continue to crank up the pressure on Arsenal, Pep Guardiola tells his players to take three days off to "enjoy life" with "caipirinhas and daiquiris".

articles.title: This is level we have to play at for rest of season - Guardiola
articles.description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola is full of praise for forward Erling Haaland and says his side need to play "at this level" for the rest of the season after they beat Newcastle 2-1 at Etihad Stadiu

articles.title: O'Reilly scores twice as Man City beat Newcastle
articles.description: Manchester City move to within two points of Premier League leaders Arsenal with a tense victory against Newcastle United at Etihad Stadium.

articles.title: Deal with 'noise' or join another club - Arteta
articles.description: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta says his players should "be part of a different club" if they can not deal with the "noise" as his team bid to end their 22-year wait for a league title.

articles.title: Tottenham & Newcastle eye Nunez - Sunday's gossip
articles.description: Tottenham and Newcastle want to bring Darwin Nunez back to the Premier League, Joe Gomez might leave Liverpool this summer, Roma and Juventus join the race for Marcos Senesi, plus more.

articles.title: Ten-man Chelsea drop points again as Burnley score stoppage-time equaliser
articles.description: Chelsea make it 17 points dropped from winning positions in the Premier League this season as Zian Flemming's 93rd-minute header gives Burnley a 1-1 draw, after Wesley Fofana is sent off at Stamford B

articles.title: Late Abraham goal rescues point for Villa against Leeds
articles.description: Tammy Abraham comes off the bench to score an 88th minute equaliser to cancel out Anton Stach's spectacular freekick, as Aston Villa rescue a 1-1 draw against Leeds United at Villa Park in the Premier

articles.title: Brighton ease pressure on Hurzeler with win at Brentford
articles.description: Goals from Diego Gomez and Danny Welbeck help Brighton to their first league win in six games, as Fabian Hurzeler's side see off Brentford 2-0 at the GTech Community Stadium.

articles.title: West Ham held to goalless draw by Bournemouth
articles.description: Third-bottom West Ham spurn the chance to put pressure on the teams above them in the table as they are held to a 0-0 draw at home to Bournemouth.

articles.title: Oâ€™Reilly doubles up as Manchester City sink Newcastle to keep up title chase

articles.title: 'Educate yourself and your kids' - Fofana and Mejbri racially abused
articles.description: Burnley midfielder Hannibal Mejbri and Chelsea defender Wesley Fofana have spoken out on social media after being sent racist abuse in the aftermath of the clubs' Premier League match on Saturday.

articles.title: All change at Spurs again and Igor Tudor has a relegation battle on his hands | Jonathan Wilson

articles.title: West Ham miss chance to boost survival hopes with wasteful draw against Bournemouth
articles.description: When it comes to the back end of May and West Ham reflect on the season that was, there is every chance that this soggy Saturday will go down as a missed opportunity that proved decisive in their surv

articles.title: Red cards and poor home form - Chelsea 'set fire to points'
articles.description: Chelsea have more red cards than any side in the Premier League this season, and boss Liam Rosenior says they have "set fire" to points.

articles.title: 'Like a dream' - Abraham relishing Villa return
articles.description: Seven years since firing them into the Premier League, Tammy Abraham is back scoring goals at Aston Villa to keep their fans and players dreaming of glory.

articles.title: 'I still feel I can contribute' - Milner on breaking Premier League record
articles.description: James Milner reacts to breaking the record for most appearances in the Premier League.

articles.title: Parker 'proud' of Burnley's 'resilience'
articles.description: Burnley head coach Scott Parker says he is "proud" of his side's "resilience" in their 1-1 Premier League draw with Chelsea at Stamford Bridge.

articles.title: Emery reflects on 'deserved draw' against Leeds
articles.description: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery remains upbeat after their draw with Leeds United, saying the result is a point gained rather than two points lost.

articles.title: Chelsea lacked ruthlessness in Burnley draw - Rosenior
articles.description: Chelsea head coach Liam Rosenior believes his side lacked the ruthlessness in their 1-1 draw with Burnley at Stamford Bridge in the Premier League.

articles.title: From Â£70 a week to Premier League record 24 years later
articles.description: James Milner has broken the Premier League appearance record, 24 years after making his debut as a 16-year-old.

articles.title: Farke 'proud' of his warriors despite disappointment with Villa draw
articles.description: Leeds United manager Daniel Farke is "disappointed" with his side's late draw against Aston Villa but believes the result is a "fair outcome" in an "equal game".

articles.title: 'Drive and hunger' take Milner to Premier League appearance record
articles.description: Brighton's James Milner starts against Brentford to break the all-time Premier League appearance record in his 654th match.

articles.title: We're so close, we have to keep pushing - Abraham
articles.description: Aston Villa striker Tammy Abraham tells Final Score "anything can happen" in the Premier League title race and that his side have to keep pushing to get close to Arsenal.

articles.title: Tammy Abraham salvages late point for Aston Villa to deny battling Leeds

articles.title: Tudor could stay at Tottenham for 'long time'
articles.description: Sporting director Johan Lange says Igor Tudor could be given the Tottenham job on a permanent basis if he impresses during the remainder of the season.

articles.title: 'Brilliant' Park strikes again for Man Utd
articles.description: Jess Park scores a stunner in Manchester United's 2-0 win over Atletico Madrid, sealing their place in the quarter-finals of the Women's Champions League.

articles.title: What's eating Arsenal? North London derby now a test of Gunners' 'bottle'
articles.description: What's eating Arsenal? Sunday's North London derby is now a test of the Gunners' "bottle", says chief football writer Phil McNulty.
